required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality Control of Esophagogastroduodenoscopy Using Real-time EGD Auxiliary System
clinical_study.official_title: Utilization of Real-time Automatic Quality-control System in the Detection of Gastric Neoplasms

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of our study was to develop an automatic quality-control system and assess the performance of this system in quality control of esophagogastroduodenoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the researchers firstly developed an automatic quality-control system, name as EAS. Next, the researchers applied the system in a endoscopic center and designed a prospective randomised controlled trial to investigate the performance of the system in quality control of esophagogastroduodenoscopy.

primary_outcome.description: detection rate of gastric neoplasms in different groups

secondary_outcome.measure: mean number of gastric neoplasms detected
secondary_outcome.description: mean number of gastric neoplasms detected per procedure in different groups
inspection completeness per procedure in different groups
inspection time per procedure in different groups
errors of EAS in EAS-aided group

arm_group.description: esophagogastroduodenoscopy examination with the assistance of automatic quality-control system
conventional standard esophagogastroduodenoscopy examination without the assistance of automatic quality-control system

intervention.description: Automatic quality-control system could real-time measuring endoscopic inspection completeness, detecting gastric neoplasms and evaluating gastric mucosal visibility.

facility.name: Department of Gastroenterology, Qilu Hospital, Shandong University
